title: EastEnders actress Maisie Smith hints new Leo King and Whitney Dean plot drama
text:
Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

EastEnders actress Maisie Smith has revealed Tiffany Butcher will get involved in sister Whitney Dean's latest storyline, following a twist.

Whitney has no idea her new flame Leo King is the son of her abuser and former stepfather Tony King.

Tony groomed and sexually abused Whitney when she was a teenager, while he was with her adoptive mother Bianca Jackson, leading to him being sent to prison where he later took his own life.

While Leo's identity remains a secret for now to Whitney, Tiffany will worry for her sibling in upcoming scenes with actress Maisie now confirming this exclusively to Mirror Online at the Inside Soap Awards 2019.

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

The star explained that while they won't know who Leo is, Whitney's past will see Tiff get involved as a means of looking out for her.

Maisie also teased the plot might go on for some time, as Leo's intentions for Whit come to light.

She told us: "Tiffany will get involved a bit cos she's wary of Whitney's [past] and she's always got a new lover on the go.

(Image: BBC / Jack Barnes)

(Image: BBC)



"She's sort of her big sister in a way, looking after her."

Maisie added: "You never know what's gonna happen, I don't even know."

On the the plot continuing for a while, she explained: "Probably, because it's quite an important storyline so I think it can."

(Image: BBC / Jack Barnes)

She and co-star Zack Morris also teased their characters' futures on the show, with Tiffany's romance with Keegan Baker blossoming - amid rumours the teenagers will get married.

Zack told us: "We've got some good stuff coming up and we're gonna see it grow. Nice stuff for a change."

Maisie added: "There is so much I wanna say but I can't.

"With us two I think we've both been through so much on the show, and it'll be nice for viewers to see them grow together happily so that's why you should tune in."

EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays at 8pm, and Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7:30pm on BBC One.
description: EXCLUSIVE: EastEnders star Maisie Smith has revealed all on Leo King, and Tiffany Butcher's romance with Keegan Baker
